The IT as a Utility network is a theme within the Research Councils UK Digital Economy Programme. It is funding this project as part of its commitment to understanding and exploiting IT utilities behind the digital economy.

Tom Lodge is a Research Fellow in Nottingham University's Department of Computer Science. He is the primary investigator on Communities in the Clouds. His research interests include domestic networks and the management and explotation of personal (digital) data.

Ben Bedwell is currently a Co-Investigator in the Creating the Energy for Change (C-tech) project. He is also leading the PowerPlay project. Both projects are revealing new ways to employ energy monitoring and feedback systems to encourage sustainable behaviour.

Alex taylor is a sociologist working at Microsoft Research Cambridge in the Socio-Digital Systems Group. He has undertaken investigations into a range of routine and often mundane aspects of everyday life. Most recently he's begun obsessing over computation and wondering what the compulsion for seeing data eveywhere might mean for being human and being social.

OM Property Management are one of UK's leading managing agents. They manage over 90,000 individual homes spread across 1900 developments throughout the UK.

Established in 1983, Crabtree Property Management is a leading independent managing agent with a portfolio over 17,000 flats spread across London and the South East.
